help.title: Help - Mob Name
help.description: This option allows you to customize the name of the mob you will summon. The name you write here will be visible floating above the mob when you summon it in the game.

help.title: Help - Mob Amount
help.description: This option allows you to define how many mobs you want to summon at once. The maximum limit is 20 mobs per summon.

help.title: Help - Mob Position
help.description: This option lets you define where the mob will appear. You can choose between relative position (relative to the player) or absolute position (world coordinates). Enter X and Y values to determine the exact spawn point.

help.title: Help - Equipped Item
help.description: This option allows you to choose the item the mob will hold in its hand. The selected item will appear in the mob's hand when summoned.

help.title: Help - Mob Health
help.description: This option lets you set how much health the mob will have when it appears. The value should be between 1 and 1000 health points.

help.title: Help - Default Loot
help.description: This option allows you to enable or disable the mob's default loot. When enabled, the mob will drop its default configured items on death.

fields.item_type_color_wool_b: Item Tag - Type Color Wool B:
fields.item_type_color_glass_b: Item Tag - Type Color Glass B:

help.title: Help - Loot Tags
help.description: Loot tags control special behaviors when the mob dies, such as the chance to drop rare items.

helpTexts.bonus: Allows obtaining a random number of extra items, up to the specified value, if the conditions are met. Defaults to 0.
helpTexts.lootBonus: Allows a random number of extra items to drop when using the maximum looting enchantment, up to the specified value, if the conditions are met. Defaults to 0.
helpTexts.chance: Controls whether the item drops or not. A random value between 0 and 1 is generated: the item drops if the value is between min (inclusive) and max (exclusive). If multiple items share the same seed, they use the same value; overlapping ranges may cause multiple items to drop, while separated ranges allow only one.
helpTexts.onFire: The item only drops if the entity is on fire at the moment it dies.
helpTexts.size: The item only drops if the mob’s size matches the specified value.
helpTexts.isBaby: The item only drops if the mob is (or is not) a baby, depending on the specified value.
helpTexts.variant: The item only drops if the mob’s variant matches the specified one. Only applies to mobs that have variants (for example: normal, mooshroom, cowctus).
helpTexts.isSheared: The item only drops if the sheep’s color matches the specified value.
helpTexts.color: The item only drops if the sheep’s color matches the specified value. Only applies to sheep mobs.
helpTexts.item_name: Overrides the item’s name, as if it were renamed using an anvil. Applies to all items.
helpTexts.item_unbreakable: If enabled and the item is a tool, it will never lose durability. Applies to all tools.
helpTexts.item_enchantment: Defines the enchantments applied to the item. Applies to all items.
helpTexts.item_canPlaceOn: Specifies which blocks the item can be placed on in Adventure mode. Can be a single block, multiple blocks, or all, which allows placing it on any block.
helpTexts.item_canDestroy: Specifies which blocks the item can destroy in Adventure mode. Can be a single block, multiple blocks, or all, which allows breaking any block.
helpTexts.item_showParticles: Defines the potion’s category. For example, using splash makes it a splash potion. Only applies to potions.
helpTexts.item_category: Defines the potion’s category. For example, using splash makes it a splash potion. Only applies to potions.
helpTexts.item_command: Specifies the command that a command book will run when used. Only applies to command books; the command is not validated on creation.
helpTexts.item_uses: Specifies how many times a command book can be used before it disappears. Only applies to command books.
helpTexts.item_anvilUses: Specifies how many times the item has been used in an anvil. Only affects the cost of future anvil operations. Applies to all items.
helpTexts.item_type_spawnegg: Defines which creature the spawn egg will generate. This value determines the mob that will appear when the egg is used, such as a zombie, an Ender Dragon, or any other supported entity.
helpTexts.item_type_balloon: Defines the type or color of the balloon that will be generated. Depending on the selected value, the balloon’s appearance may change or use special supported variants.
helpTexts.item_type_potion: Specifies the type of potion that will be generated. This can be an empty potion, a water bottle, or a potion with specific effects. The selected value defines how the potion behaves when used.

help.title: Help - Mob Armor
help.description: This option lets you equip the mob with different pieces of armor. You can choose helmet, chestplate, leggings and boots of various materials.

help.title: Help - Aggressiveness
help.description: This option lets you define the mob's aggressive behavior. Hostile will attack players, Neutral will only attack if provoked, and Passive will never attack.

help.title: Help - Skin ID
help.description: Enter the numeric ID of the skin you want to assign to the mob. Only numbers are allowed (e.g. 76198). In the command it will be added as `skin:76198`.

help.title: Help - Charged Creeper
help.description: Enable this option to turn the creeper into a charged variant. The command will include `charged:1` when enabled.

baby.title: Baby
baby.description: Configure how the mob should appear in its baby variant. Choose 'Always' for baby:true or 'Time' to specify a number to appear as baby:N in the command.

help.title: Help - Baby
help.description: Set whether the mob should be spawned as a baby. 'Always' sets baby:true. 'Time' allows entering a numeric value that will be used as baby:N in the generated command.

settings.title: Settings
settings.importInvalidFile: Invalid import file - expected an array of saved items

notifications.select_mob: You must select a mob first

loot.missing: You must add an item first
